page.title: 01The Domesday Flight
page.content: We left school at about 1pm and drove to Fairoaks Airfield on the outskirts of Woking. Near the runway there was a small marquee containing displays of aircraft. There was also a display of four different routes. We were going to take flight four. The aircraft we were travelling in was an{Islander.}An Islander has its wings above the engines and windows giving you a good view of the ground. Our flight was behind schedule, we were supposed to fly at 2:30pm but instead we had to wait until 3:30pm. Whilst waiting we watched several aircraft ascending and descending, it was quite fascinating. Mr. Waters took photographs of us for the school records while Mr. Heslop took photograghs for the local press. Before our flight a marshal gave us a
